title: OffGrid Studios exhibition concludes after thrilling week of showcasing exquisite artwork
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 10 (APP):OffGrid Studios latest exhibition, “Be a Catalyst; Reimagining Connection with Gaia,” Chapter 2 concluded at Pakistan National Council of the Arts (PNCA) on Wednesday after a thrilling week of showcasing exceptional artwork.
The event, held at Gallery 06 of National Art Gallery, PNCA,  brought together art enthusiasts, collectors, and the community to appreciate the talents of 15 participating artists.
A great number of visitors attended the exhibition, exceeding expectations.
The visitors and artists praised the exhibition’s curation, venue, and overall experience. OffGrid thanked collaborators especially PNCA for providing such a wonderful gallery for the display of the artworks.
Ms. Geytee Ara, the curator of the show, also thanked the participants, and team of Visual Arts Division, PNCA for their invaluable support.
The exhibition’s success demonstrates the power of art in bringing people together and inspiring meaningful conversation.
Speaking on the occasion, Director Visual Arts Division, Ms. Mariam Ahmed explained that PNCA as a thriving center for creativity and innovation in the country, continually pushing the boundaries of artistic expression and collaboration.
She noted that the exhibition featured a thought-provoking array of artworks delving into environmental themes, each piece offering a unique viewpoint on pressing ecological issues. The participating artists brought forth their creativity to spark meaningful conversations about the current state of our planet and potential pathways for positive change.
This compelling exhibition invited visitors to explore diverse perspectives on our relationship with the Earth, viewed through the lens of Gaia, the living entity. The opening of the exhibition was done by Ms Romina Khurshid Alam, Coordinator to the Prime Minister on Climate Control and Environmental Coordination.
Geytee Ara,  Lubna Jehangir, Khurram Babary, Faiza Gondal, Shahzeb Ahmad, Rahat Shahid, Tayyaba Faisal, Saffia Mughees, Dr. Maimoona Khan, Sidra Ali, Tanzeel Babary, Sidra Ashraf, Syeda Nadia Raza, Samreen Asghar and Zarar Haider Babary brought their distinct voices and visions to the forefront, enriching the discourse with their profound insights and artistic prowess.
OffGrid Studios is a pioneering initiative dedicated to fostering creativity and innovation in art, with a strong focus on environmental awareness and sustainability.
Through exhibitions, residencies, and community engagement, OffGrid Studios aims to harness the transformative power of art to address pressing global challenges.
